Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Recommend 1.x or 2.x for use with Solr?

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	format=flowed;
	delsp=yes
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I sort had felt that the Nutch project was fairly inactive...  And I  
like the Solr/Heretrix approach of separating the responsibility for  
Crawling from the responsibility of Searching...

I am looking at some of the nutchwax code to see how to parse ARC  
records and pull out content.

Eric

On Apr 26, 2009, at 5:24 PM, Felix Zimmermann wrote:

>
>
> Hi David,
>
> I took the latest Heritrix 1.x, the latest NutchWax binary and the
> latest Nutch 1.0 trunk and everything works fine except there is a
> SHA1-String in the field of the url.
>
> First, you crawl the websites with Heritrix. With
> ".../nutch/bin/nutchwax import ...", you convert the .arc-files of
> Heritrix into Nutch segments. Afterwards, you only use Nutch. Generate
> the linkdb with ".../nutch/bin/nutch updatedb ...", afterwards
> ".../bin/nutch invertlinks ..." and then ".../bin/nutch  
> solrindex ...".
>
> Have a look into the file nutchwax-0.12.3/contrib/archive/HOWTO.txt,
> found in the distribution
> http://downloads.sourceforge.net/archive-access/ 
> nutchwax-0.12.3b.tar.gz
>
> Before, I tried the ArcSegmentTool of Nutch, but it is buggy. Sure,  
> the
> best way would be to write a new heritrix-writer for solr, but I do  
> not
> know how to do this.
>
> Best regards
> Felix.
>
> Am Sonntag, den 26.04.2009, 18:02 +0000 schrieb David Pugh:
> >
> >
> > Hi all,
> >
> > I am looking download a lot of content from a website, and then go
> > back and index pages that meet a certain pattern using Solr. Is  
> there
> > a recommendation for 1.x or 2.x? Has anyone indexed content into  
> Solr
> > from archive-crawler?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
> 

-----------------------------------------------------
Eric Pugh | Principal | OpenSource Connections, LLC | 434.466.1467 | http://www.opensourceconnections.com
Free/Busy: http://tinyurl.com/eric-cal





--Apple-Mail-142-538415289
